messages.message: In my sandbox (https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/xindixu-v4?cw=dev) using `ibdev-backend`. I'm unable to compile and restart core-platform-service. Anyone knows where to look for a fix? Details in the thread:thread:

I tried:
```$ cs start core-platform
daemon:core-platform@instabase: Starting
daemon:core-platform@instabase: Failed to start```

Logs from core-platform
```$ cs logs -f core-platform
✔ select the only one - DAEMON:core-platform@instabase
make: Entering directory '/home/owner/instabase/core-services/core-platform-service'
Host OS is linux
/usr/bin/env: 'python': No such file or directory
make: *** [Makefile:29: build-docker] Error 127
make: Leaving directory '/home/owner/instabase/core-services/core-platform-service'
make: Entering directory '/home/owner/instabase/core-services/core-platform-service'```
Maybe it's pointing to this code? https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/5cb87a1df715b0f6816ea9a4b6ad71afff7df486/releng/scripts/gomodgen#L1
@Xindi Xu make sure you include the pyenv setup snippet in your zshrc or bashrc. That will fix this!
Ohh! I’ll try it out tmr. Thank you!

So Python is installed out of the box in crafting sandboxes.
What happened is that the `#!/usr/bin/env python` can't find the python in the path. I resolved this by adding a symlink like so `sudo ln -s /usr/bin/python3 /usr/bin/python`
